page.title: 03POPULATION / Ecology
page.content: The estimated population of the area is approx. 400 and the average age of the population is 45-50, although there are far more elderly people than young ones. Welsh is the predominant language but nearly everyone can read, speak and write English. The area experiences a moderate climate. The prevailing wind is a south westerly. In winter time rainfall is above average and there is a tendency for the last few winters to have above average snow and frost as well. There are several public footpaths and these are well sign posted. The lanes as well as the main road are looked after by Clwyd County Council roadmen. There is a conservation policy to protect the flora and fauna in the countryside so the grass verges and banks are not cut back. All hedges are trimmed by land owners.
